meanings.definition: To openly resist or refuse to obey
meanings.sent1: The brave knight decided to defy the dragon and protect the village.
meanings.sent2: The students decided to defy the strict teacher's rules and have a picnic in the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel seemed to defy the laws of gravity as it leaped from tree to tree.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to defy all odds and succeed was truly inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The storm continued to defy the forecasters, changing direction unpredictably.

meanings.definition: To challenge or provoke someone or something
meanings.sent1: The young boy liked to defy his friends to a race to see who was the fastest.
meanings.sent2: The rebellious teenager would often defy authority figures just to prove a point.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy would defy the older dog to a game of chase around the yard.
meanings.sent4: Her bold fashion choices seemed to defy the traditional norms of the industry.
meanings.sent5: The artist's abstract paintings seemed to defy interpretation, leaving viewers puzzled.

meanings.definition: To be impossible to explain or understand
meanings.sent1: The magic trick seemed to defy logic, leaving the audience in awe.
meanings.sent2: The mysterious disappearance of the treasure chest seemed to defy all explanations.
meanings.sent3: The strange creature in the forest seemed to defy all known classifications.
meanings.sent4: Her sudden burst of energy seemed to defy all medical explanations.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins seemed to defy time itself, standing strong against the elements.
